revised_title: Pelvic Plexus Formation in Mustelus: Nervus Collector and Migration
tldr: This study investigates the formation of the pelvic plexus in the Mustelus species, focusing on the nervus collector and its relation to migration. The research reveals that the collector's formation is due to the migration of the fin rostrally, providing evidence against the excalation theory. The findings support the migration theory and contribute to understanding the development of the nervous system in Mustelus species.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Comparative Anatomy
